p: The mean value of CEO yield was found to be low (0.6%), this being in accordance with previously reported studies on the amount of CEOs in seeds in the range from 0.2% to 1.5% [ 22]. The GC-MS profiles of CEO chemical composition and concentration (in order of elution) are listed in Table 1. In CEO, twenty-one compounds were identified comprising 99.76% of the total EO composition. Monoterpene hydrocarbons (MH) were identified at 39.204%, while monoterpene oxygenates (MO) represented 60.556% of the total compounds. The chromatographic profile of CEO showed that linalool was the major compound, at 45.387%, followed by α-pinene, at 11.626%, and D-limonene, at 9.628% ( Table 1). Other compounds identified with a concentration higher than 5% were p-cymene (8.00%), camphor (6.016%), and γ-terpinene (5.236%).
